agreement.text: The patient records available through this data source are only for the use of authorized practices, physicians, nurses, employees or staff who have signed confidentiality agreements on file with the entity from which these records are obtained. These records contain information which is privileged, confidential and exempt from disclosure under applicable law. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any access, dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. Browsing for information regarding patients that are not under your immediate care is strictly prohibited, as is tampering or otherwise interfering with the electronic information delivery system. Patient care decisions should not be based solely on the medical images or report summaries that can be accessed here. Integration of clinical and laboratory information, review of the final radiology report, and, when appropriate, consultation with the radiologist(s) is recommended.</br></br> Your viewing of these records is tracked. Do you wish to proceed while agreeing to view only those patient’s records for which you have a clinical need?
agreement.declineAgreementText: You will not be able to access the portal without accepting the agreement. Do you want to sign out?

If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any access, dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. uploadFiles.confirmMessageOnUploadAll: This will upload all the files. Are you sure you want to proceed?
uploadFiles.confirmMessageOnSubmit: Have you uploaded all your medical records?
uploadFiles.confirmMessageOnFolderUpload: Use this tool to upload DICOM(s) provided by multiple patients. After you select this option, a .jnlp file is downloaded to your system. Ensure that JRE 7 (or newer version) is already installed before executing this file.
uploadFiles.confirmMessageOnBulkUploadAsServiceUploa: Use this tool to upload all the DICOMs available on your system/network to the portal automatically. After you select this option, a set of instructions is displayed. Follow these instructions to configure the service correctly. In case of any difficulties, please contact your system administrator.
uploadFiles.BulkUploadStudiesText: Use this tool to upload CDs or studies provided by multiple patients. After your you select this, a .jnlp file is downloaded to your system. Ensure that JRE 7 (or newer version) is already installed before executing this file.
uploadFiles.BulkUploadAsServiceText: Use this tool to upload all the DICOMs available on your system/network to the portal automatically. After you select this option, a set of instructions is displayed. Follow these instructions to configure the service correctly. In case of any difficulties, please contact your system administrator.
uploadFiles.BulkUploaderInstructionText:
1. click the download button ,a zip file with default properties will be downloaded .
  2. Unzip the zip into a folder lets say c:\Users\some admin user\MphRx-BulkUploader-Service
  3. Now user can go inside the c:\Users\some admin user\MphRx-BulkUploader-Service and modify the bulkUploader.properties file according to its specifications
  4. change the listenerIP (that should be LAN IP address of the machine you are installing this on), serverURL (this should be the MphRx WebConnect URL where Skywalker will send the studies), username (a valid username for web connect which will be used to send the studies), password (password for this user) and localDirectory (make sure the path has forward slashes not Windows style backward slashes) , there are few things already provided in the file,which need not be changed like : client id , secret , token ,etc.
  5. now run setup.bat inside the c:\Users\some admin user\MphRx-BulkUploader-Service , right click on that file and select run as administrator .
  6. your service will now have been installed as a windows service and can be used to send data using dcm toolkit 2 dcm send method .You can check your Services Control Manager in Windows (you can use %windir%\system32\services.msc from the command window)
  7. The log file will be in c:\Users\some admin user\MphRx-BulkUploader-Service\logs\bulkUploader.log
  8. To test, you can send a DICOM file to MPHRXSKYWALKER@your ip address:9212, it should get uploaded by Skywalker to the WebConnect URL automatically.
  9. To change something in the properties file, you have to stop the service, change the properties file and then restart the service.
uploadFiles.BulkUploaderInstructionHeader: Instructions to install Bulk Uploader As Service
